intro: Malvastrum scoparium, commonly known as the sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with hairy stems and lobed leaves. Its showy, yellow-centered flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
